author: VanVangor
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
# Run this from an elevated prompt.
# Local computer should be using C: as its system drive.
# "MyComputer" can be any computer on the network.  It doesn't have to be the local computer.
# More detail about issue: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47802040/why-does-test-connection-force-enumeration-of-reparse-points

Test-Connection -Computer MyComputer;
$FileList = @(Get-ChildItem -Path C:\ -Recurse -Force -Attributes !ReparsePoint);
$FileList | Where-Object {$_.DirectoryName -like "*Documents and Settings*"};
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```
# Because reparse points are blocked, entries within the "C:\Documents and Settings\" tree should NOT show up in the list.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
# Entries from the "C:\Documents and settings\" tree show up in the list.
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.16299.98
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.16299.98
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


PS C:\WINDOWS\system32>

```
